How are we going from chassis<->fans?  Need associations documented anywhere?

> How are we going from chassis<->fans?  Need associations documented anywhere?

fans<->fan_tach sensor<->all_sensors<->chassis
https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/fd0ec1f9212f127bf302dd4ceb8f4fa2e29a5f1d/architecture/sensor-architecture.md#association-names

> > How are we going from chassis<->fans?  Need associations documented anywhere?
> 
> fans<->fan_tach sensor<->all_sensors<->chassis
> https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/fd0ec1f9212f127bf302dd4ceb8f4fa2e29a5f1d/architecture/sensor-architecture.md#association-names

@Gunnar, @Ed
Relevant associated documents are here:
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/58300
Can you add this to the commit msg?
Done
Redfish.md update?
Can this be generic?

> Can this be generic?

updated it

Shouldn't this have already checked chassis?
Should you just leave off if this association doesn't exist?

> Shouldn't this have already checked chassis?
> Should you just leave off if this association doesn't exist?

Updated it
What about the chassis association? How does it know which chassis these belong to?

If we have 2chassisId, like `chassis1`, `chassis2`:

when we want to get the FanSpeedsPercent property via `/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassi1`, the validChassisPath property value is `/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/chassis1`

when we want to get the FanSpeedsPercent property via `/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassi2`, the validChassisPath property value is `/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/chassis2`

https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/57715/11/redfish-core/lib/environment_metrics.hpp#176
Done
nit: value can be const reference since its a input argument

> nit: value can be const reference since its a input argument

No, because value a POD

Done

Shouldn't we move the functions to common utility file and use it?

Thanks
Added fan_utils.hpp
Please document this appropriately.  this is an array of objects, that have sub properties that you've implemented at least a few of (DeviceName for example), and they should be documented.
Done
non trivial lambda.
Done

Please build a list, and return to the callback as a list.  "One callback per async action" is an asio convention that helps code stay stable, because it makes it very clear when there could be multiple of an object.

> Please build a list, and return to the callback as a list.

Sorry, I am not following what this means.

>  "One callback per async action" 

I have updated as per this suggestion

> > Please build a list, and return to the callback as a list.
> 
> Sorry, I am not following what this means.

it means don't call the callback in a loop.

> 
> >  "One callback per async action" 
> 
> I have updated as per this suggestion

With Myung's help I've restructured the code a bit in order to build a vector of the fanSensorPaths and services to path to the callback for filling in the property values.

Additionally I've moved the sort of this vector rather than after each update of the JSON array.
Once we get this based on the existing code and producing the correct values, then I'll review if this is complete.
non trivial lambda.
Done
internal error?
Done
nlohmann::json::object_t
Done

SensorCollection doesn't implement DeviceName, so this patchset can't just add without adding support in sensor.hpp.  This is supposed to be an "excerpt" which in Redfish terms is a less populated version of the same schema.  If Sensor doesn't implement DeviceName, we can't just add it in the excerpt version.

Please just implement this as an "excerpt" mode on the existing sensor get code.

In addition, this is not a device name, per the redfish spec.
Updated

The DeviceName property for a SensorFanArrayExcerpt is defined "shall contain the value of the `Name` property of the associated resource".

So I've modified how this property is built here to build it the same way it is built in objectPropertiesToJson() [1]

[1] https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/fa2d6ae7034875a61314380295a88dc8abaa34a1/redfish-core/lib/sensors.hpp#L761

Not sure where you're getting your text, but here's where I"m getting mine:

https://github.com/DMTF/Redfish-Publications/blob/bff927ee3cd16e0c059845fba976bf738b0717b2/csdl/Sensor_v1.xml#L860

""This property shall contain the name of the device associated with this sensor.  If the device is represented by a resource, the value shall contain the value of the `Name` property of the associated resource."

Based on that description, DeviceName should be the name of the containing Chassis, NOT the name of the sensor.  Lets omit it for now until we can implement it correctly.

That is the same text I was reading. I interpreted "the associated resource" as the sensor not the chassis.

I'll remove the "DeviceName" property from the response.
Sounds good.  Feel free to close this out when done.

this is adding items to the list with no regard as to ordering.  The order from the mapper isn't defined, and certainly the order daemons reply to GetProperty requests is undefined, so you need to order there appropriately (probably with insert).

As written, i suspect that systems with multiple fan daemons will reorder this list every refresh, which doesn't meet the Redfish specification.
Updated
I've moved the sort to sort the vector produced by getFanSensorObjects(). The single callback will then add the objects in the already sorted order.
Please don't invent your own sort.  Use the existing ones, they are more correct.
I didn't realize there were existing utility functions. I've changed the sort() of the vector produced by getFanSensorObjects() to use AlphanumLess().
internalError?  If the mapper returns a fan that then doesn't exist, that's an error, right?
Correct，Done
nit, capture error codes by const reference, as you've done elsewhere in this file.
Done
I see no check to ensure that the opposite end of the "cooled_by" association is a fan inventory item.

rainier has been configured in associations.json.
https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/blob/master/meta-ibm/recipes-phosphor/inventory/phosphor-inventory-manager/p10bmc/ibm%2Crainier-2u_associations.json#L53-L56

FP5280g3 is also associated downstream, But I found that this function has not been implemented in EM.

I made no mention of EM in my comment.  I’m not sure why you bring it up.  If the rainier associations are wrong then that’s a discussion to have with that maintainer, I’m talking about the code in this patchset, which makes no mention of Fan.  If a "cooled_by" association does not point to a fan object (which is allowed in PDI), then this will return a URL that 404s.

Note that this is different than the all_sensors association, or chassis association, that by convention, we KNOW associates to a Sensor object.

Got it.
Updated

As written, this looks like it implements

Chassis -> cooled_by -> sensor.  Which is incorrect.  I'm not sure how that would work, and is likely relying on hardcoded associations for a specific system?

Chassis -> cooled_by -> Fan -> all_sensors -> Sensor

Is the appropriate association.

Now, Chassis->cooled_by->Fan->sensors(all_sensors == sensor for Fan)
I think this is correct, https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/blob/master/meta-ibm/recipes-phosphor/inventory/phosphor-inventory-manager/p10bmc/ibm%2Crainier-2u_associations.json#L15-L27

Because for fan0, it may be a dual rotor or a single rotor.

> Now, Chassis->cooled_by->Fan->sensors(all_sensors == sensor for Fan)
> I think this is correct, 

that’s not what was in code though.  there is no mention of all_sensors in this patchset.

> https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/blob/master/meta-ibm/recipes-phosphor/inventory/phosphor-inventory-manager/p10bmc/ibm%2Crainier-2u_associations.json#L15-L27
> 
> Because for fan0, it may be a dual rotor or a single rotor.
Updated
George had updated already to use all_sensors. I believe that addressed this review comment. Please let me know if I'm missing something else for this one.

this
A. Doesn't match what you documented
B. Doesn't match the spec. 

Yet you say the Service validator passed, can you provide the passing test result?  I suspect there's a bug in the service validator if this passed.

To be honest, I haven't run the validator since I joined `SensorFanArrayExcerpt`.

you mentioned：
```
SensorCollection doesn't implement DeviceName, so this patchset can't just add without adding support in sensor.hpp. This is supposed to be an "excerpt" which in Redfish terms is a less populated version of the same schema. If Sensor doesn't implement DeviceName, we can't just add it in the excerpt version.

Please just implement this as an "excerpt" mode on the existing sensor get code.

In addition, this is not a device name, per the redfish spec.
```

So I think it should be added `SensorFanArrayExcerpt` right?

The Redfish Service Validator version 2.4.8 passed with this. It does not validate the DataSourceUri. I've opened an issue against the validator to address that:
https://github.com/DMTF/Redfish-Service-Validator/issues/598
Please document with slashes.  Look at the examples that start with Links/ for how these are documented.
Done

Please don't make multiple tiers of mapper calls.

GetSubTreePaths -> GetObject per paths is the same operation as GetSubtree.
Done
all_sensors
Done

Why are we parsing the name to get the index here?  what if the fan names are 


foo
bar
baz

?

Names are user facing.  There's no requirement for them to have an index of any kind in them.
removed
You didn't answer the question.  That's good the code was removed, what was it replaced with?

Looking at the history here, I see the original comment was on a function getFanId(). That function was used only for building the value that was being used in patch set 19 to set the "DeviceName" property value. George removed that function and changed how "DeviceName" value was built.

In patch set 22 I added getFanSensorIdAndName() to build the "DeviceName" value based on how the sensor's "Name" value is also built.

In the latest patch set I'm removing "DeviceName" property completely.
Excellent.  Thank you for the insight Janet.  Closing.
FYI. I'm going to start working on addressing the code review comments of this commit and the other unmerged commits for this same topic.

George, we have a communication problem here.  Closing out comments with one word "Updated" is perfectly acceptable when you're being asked for a trivial change and you made the change, but in a lot of these cases you haven't actually made the change asked for, nor did you answer the question asked, so it's unclear what you think should happen next when you answer with one word replies.

I see Janet has taken over, and seems to be answering the comments with more than one word answers, maybe we can try that, but reviewing this code over and over again and being ignored isn't going to work.
Should be array markers [] on these because FanSpeedsPercent is an array.
Done
we have existing sorts that handle human things correctly.  Please use them.  Don't invent a new one.
I didn't realize there were existing utility functions. I've changed the sort() here to use AlphanumLess().

I'm not really sure how many times i can say this, so I'll try again.  There's existing code that produces a sensor value.  This code has to match EXACTLY for the spec to be fulfilled, with the subtraction of entries not marked in excerpt.

Today, there is no code that sets a sensor values SpeedRPM property, we only set Reading, so we can't have the excerpt version set SpeedRPM, and the non excerpt version set Reading.

The only way to ensure that these two stay the same is to have the same code generate both.  This patchset continues to ignore this.

This is the method that needs abstracted to add an "excerpt" mode.  https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/ea5e22424e00d9134556a966fe4c2a28dcbb94dc/redfish-core/lib/sensors.hpp#L745

Please do as I've asked.  This code is still incorrect to the standard.



If we want to change to support SpeedRPM instead of or in addition to Reading in the sensor list, that's a different patch.

I misunderstood your earlier comment about excerpts to be specific to returning the "DeviceName" property only. I see now that it was meant more generally.

I will be pursuing a separate commit to implement SpeedRPM for fans in the /redfish/v1/Chassis/<chassis>/Sensors/<fanSensor> path.

I'll mark this commit as WIP until that one merges then return to this one to handle this as an excerpt mode.
Great.  Thanks Janet.
I don't seem to have permission to mark this one Work-in-Progress in gerrit. I've altered the commit message instead.
